feed.title: MSFS Blog
feed.subtitle: Development updates of Microsoft Flight Simulator.

entry.title: 40th Anniversary Stream Schedule
entry.summary: Next week we will be hosting several Anniversary streams! Each stream will take place at 2000Z / 12PM PST, with the exception of our Dev Q&A which will be at 1830Z.

entry.title: America’s First Black Astronauts
entry.summary: During the Cold War space race of the 1960s, there were three truths about American astronauts: Every astronaut was a major celebrity, mobbed by the media and an adoring public alike wherever they went. Every astronaut was recruited to the space program exclusively from the ranks of military test pilots. Every astronaut was a white … Continued

entry.title: Local Legend VIII: DHC-4 Caribou
entry.summary: One of the most capable aircraft for austere and bush flying, the DHC-4 Caribou, is the eighth in the Local Legend Series.

entry.title: February 16th, 2023 Development Update
entry.summary: Following-up on our update from last week, the development team continues to prepare the first Sim Update 12 beta for release to those players who have opted in to receive test builds.

entry.title: World Update XII: New Zealand Now Available!
entry.summary: Lift into the sky above New Zealand and soar among snow-kissed peaks, across vertical-walled fjords, and past modern architectural feats.

entry.title: World Update XII Sale
entry.summary: 7 Items On Sale Now in the Marketplace

entry.title: February 23rd, 2023 Development Update
entry.summary: Screenshot by JohnStarp (Forum) Kia ora! We are thrilled to release World Update XII: New Zealand, available now as a free download from the in-sim Marketplace to all players. You can read all about the new content included in this update here. Launching alongside WU12 is the latest in our series of Local Legend planes. This time, … Continued

entry.title: Famous Flyer IV: Antonov AN-225 Mriya
entry.summary: As part of Microsoft Flight Simulator’s ongoing digital preservation efforts, we are pleased to introduce the world’s largest aircraft, the Ukrainian-built Antonov An-225 Mriya.
